snippet: Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy has been forced to confront a rising tide of fraud accusations and calls from the opposition for him to resign.
abstract: Spain's Prime Min Mariano Rajoy insists he will not yield to blackmail and resign, even as he is confronted by intensifying corruption scandal; former party treasurer Luis Barcenas has reportedly acknowledged before a judge that he had made payments for years to Rajoy and other center-right politicians from secret party slush fund.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy has been forced to confront a rising tide of fraud accusations and calls from the opposition for him to resign.

headline.main: Spain’s Premier Refuses to Resign in Fraud Scandal
headline.print_headline: Spain’s Premier Refuses To Resign in Fraud Scandal
